summary.para: Add a user-defined message to the message queue and send that message to debug output.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Add a Direct3D 10 debug message to the message queue and send that message to debug output.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: This method is used by the runtime's internal mechanisms to add Direct3D 10 debug messages to the message queue and send them to debug output. For applications to add their own custom messages to the message queue and send them to debug output, call .

summary.para: Add storage filters to the top of the retrieval-filter stack.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: A retrieval filter is used to define a subgroup of the messages that are already in the info queue. Retrieval filters affect the messages that will be returned by .
The number of messages already in the info queue that will be allowed through the retrieval filter can be determined by calling .

summary.para: Add storage filters to the top of the storage-filter stack.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: A storage filter defines a grouping of debug messages that should be allowed into the info queue.

summary.para: Remove a retrieval filter from the top of the retrieval-filter stack.
Remove a storage filter from the top of the storage-filter stack.
Clear all messages from the message queue.
Get a message category to break on when a message with that category passes through the storage filter.

returns.para: Whether this breaking condition is turned on or off (true for on, false for off).

summary.para: Get a message identifier to break on when a message with that identifier passes through the storage filter.

returns.para: Whether this breaking condition is turned on or off (true for on, false for off).

summary.para: Get a message severity level to break on when a message with that severity level passes through the storage filter.

param.name: Severity
param.para: Message severity level to break on (see ).

returns.para: Whether this breaking condition is turned on or off (true for on, false for off).

summary.para: Get a message from the message queue.

param.name: MessageIndex
param.para: Index into message queue after an optional retrieval filter has been applied. This can be between 0 and the number of messages in the message queue that pass through the retrieval filter (which can be obtained with ). 0 is the message at the front of the message queue.

param.name: pMessageByteLength
param.para: Size of pMessage in bytes, including the size of the message string that the pMessage points to.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: This method does not remove any messages from the message queue.
This method gets messages from the message queue after an optional retrieval filter has been applied.
Applications should call this method twice to retrieve a message - first to obtain the size of the message and second to get the message. Here is a typical example:

summary.para: Get the maximum number of messages that can be added to the message queue.

returns.para: Maximum number of messages that can be added to the queue. -1 means no limit.

remarks.para: When the number of messages in the message queue has reached the maximum limit, new messages coming in will push old messages out.

summary.para: Get a boolean that turns the debug output on or off.

returns.para: Whether the debug output is on or off (true for on, false for off).

summary.para: Get the number of messages that were allowed to pass through a storage filter.

returns.para: Number of messages allowed by a storage filter.

summary.para: Get the number of messages that were denied passage through a storage filter.

returns.para: Number of messages denied by a storage filter.

summary.para: Get the number of messages that were discarded due to the message count limit.

remarks.para: Get and set the message count limit with and , respectively.

summary.para: Get the number of messages currently stored in the message queue.

returns.para: Number of messages currently stored in the message queue.

summary.para: Get the number of messages that are able to pass through a retrieval filter.

returns.para: Number of messages allowed by a retrieval filter.

summary.para: Get the retrieval filter at the top of the retrieval-filter stack.

param.name: pFilter
param.para: Retrieval filter at the top of the retrieval-filter stack.

param.name: pFilterByteLength
param.para: Size of the retrieval filter in bytes. If pFilter is NULL, the size of the retrieval filter will be output to this parameter.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Get the size of the retrieval-filter stack in bytes.

returns.para: Size of the retrieval-filter stack in bytes.

summary.para: Get the storage filter at the top of the storage-filter stack.

param.name: pFilter
param.para: Storage filter at the top of the storage-filter stack.

param.name: pFilterByteLength
param.para: Size of the storage filter in bytes. If pFilter is NULL, the size of the storage filter will be output to this parameter.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Get the size of the storage-filter stack in bytes.

returns.para: Size of the storage-filter stack in bytes.

summary.para: Pop a retrieval filter from the top of the retrieval-filter stack.
Pop a storage filter from the top of the storage-filter stack.
Push a copy of retrieval filter currently on the top of the retrieval-filter stack onto the retrieval-filter stack.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Push a copy of storage filter currently on the top of the storage-filter stack onto the storage-filter stack.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Push an empty retrieval filter onto the retrieval-filter stack.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: An empty retrieval filter allows all messages to pass through.

summary.para: Push an empty storage filter onto the storage-filter stack.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: An empty storage filter allows all messages to pass through.

summary.para: Push a retrieval filter onto the retrieval-filter stack.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Push a storage filter onto the storage-filter stack.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Set a message category to break on when a message with that category passes through the storage filter.

param.name: bEnable
param.para: Turns this breaking condition on or off (true for on, false for off).

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Set a message identifier to break on when a message with that identifier passes through the storage filter.

param.name: bEnable
param.para: Turns this breaking condition on or off (true for on, false for off).

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Set a message severity level to break on when a message with that severity level passes through the storage filter.

param.name: Severity
param.para: Message severity level to break on (see ).

param.name: bEnable
param.para: Turns this breaking condition on or off (true for on, false for off).

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Set the maximum number of messages that can be added to the message queue.

param.name: MessageCountLimit
param.para: Maximum number of messages that can be added to the message queue. -1 means no limit.

returns.para: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: When the number of messages in the message queue has reached the maximum limit, new messages coming in will push old messages out.

summary.para: Set a boolean that turns the debug output on or off.

param.name: bMute
param.para: Disable/Enable the debug output (TRUE to disable or mute the output, FALSE to enable the output).

remarks.para: This will stop messages that pass the storage filter from being printed out in the debug output, however those messages will still be added to the message queue.

summary.para: An information-queue interface stores, retrieves, and filters debug messages. The queue consists of a message queue, an optional storage filter stack, and a optional retrieval filter stack.

remarks.para: This interface is obtained by turning on the debug layer and querying it from the using .
